title: Polish luxury UI: cinematic hero, refined navbar, deeper cards, consistent button hovers, premium font pairing

requirements.text: Replace the Home page hero image with a darker, cinematic, premium-looking background and apply a soft black gradient overlay on top of the image to achieve a luxury/high-class feel.

quotes:
Please replace the current hero image with a more cinematic and premium-looking background.
Use a darker, high-quality image with a soft black gradient overlay to create a luxury and high-class feel.

acceptanceCriteria: Home page hero image asset is updated to a darker, cinematic image (used as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated).
A soft black gradient overlay is visibly applied over the hero image without reducing text/CTA readability.
No backend image serving is introduced; the hero image is referenced directly from the Home page.

requirements.text: Refine the site navbar styling by increasing horizontal spacing between desktop menu items, increasing header padding, and adding a subtle drop shadow under the sticky navbar for depth while preserving existing navigation structure and behavior (desktop + mobile).

quotes:
Enhance the navbar by adding slightly more spacing between menu items and increasing padding.
Add a subtle shadow under the navbar to give it depth and a more professional appearance.

acceptanceCriteria: Desktop navbar menu items have noticeably increased spacing compared to current styling, without wrapping/truncation on common viewport widths.
Header container padding is increased (or otherwise feels roomier) while keeping layout aligned within the existing max width container.
A subtle shadow appears under the navbar when viewed against page content, and the navbar remains sticky and functional on scroll.
Mobile menu open/close behavior and navigation actions remain unchanged.

requirements.text: Enhance story card styling across the app by applying a slightly stronger (but still soft) shadow and adding a smooth hover interaction (subtle lift or scale) to make cards feel modern and interactive, while maintaining readability and existing content/layout.

quotes:
Improve the card design by adding a slightly stronger but soft shadow to create depth.
Also, add a smooth hover effect (such as a subtle lift or scale effect) to make the interface feel modern and interactive.

acceptanceCriteria: Cards in the Stories listing (StoryCard) have a stronger soft shadow than before, without looking harsh or overly dark.
Cards in the Stories listing show a smooth hover effect (lift and/or slight scale) with an appropriate transition duration/easing.
Home page featured story cards (LuxuryFeaturedStoryCard) maintain the luxury look and also reflect the improved depth/hover interaction (consistent feel across card types).
Hover interaction does not cause layout shift that breaks the grid (no jumping content).

requirements.text: Upgrade button interactions site-wide by ensuring all buttons have smooth hover animations with a 0.3s transition, consistent border radius, and styling aligned with the black luxury theme (preserving existing button variants and behaviors).

quotes:
Add smooth hover animations (0.3s transition effect) to all buttons.
Ensure consistent border radius and keep the button style aligned with the black luxury theme.

acceptanceCriteria: All buttons across pages have a consistent 0.3s hover transition (at minimum covering background/border/text color; include transform where applicable).
Button border radius is consistent across variants and matches the global radius token already used by the theme.
Buttons that are meant to be solid black (e.g., primary CTAs on the Home page) remain solid black with white text and have refined hover/focus states consistent with a luxury theme.
No edits are made directly inside read-only UI component source files under frontend/src/components/ui; changes are achieved via composition, styling, or global CSS/theme tokens.

requirements.text: Implement premium editorial font pairing by using a classy serif font for headings (e.g., Playfair Display or Cormorant) and a clean sans-serif font for body text (e.g., Inter or Poppins), and apply it consistently across all pages.

quotes:
Use a classy serif font for headings (such as Playfair Display or Cormorant) to give a premium editorial look.
Use a clean sans-serif font (such as Inter or Poppins) for body text to maintain readability and professionalism.

acceptanceCriteria: Headings (h1â€“h6 and heading-styled components) render with the selected serif font across the site.
Body text renders with the selected sans-serif font across the site.
Fonts are loaded correctly in the app (no fallback-only rendering in typical browsers).
Typography remains readable on mobile and desktop, and existing page layouts do not break due to font changes.

constraints: Frontend must remain within the existing React + TypeScript + Tailwind + shadcn/ui + React Query stack.
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI component sources must be composed, not edited).
Backend is single-actor Motoko; no backend changes are required for these UI polish tasks.
nonGoals: Do not add or change routes/pages.
Do not change Internet Identity authentication behavior.
Do not add new backend storage or APIs.
Do not redesign non-requested page layouts beyond the specified hero/navbar/cards/buttons/typography polish.

edits: Replace the hero background with a darker cinematic premium image (storiespk-hero-luxury.dim_1600x600.png > storiespk-hero-cinematic-dark.dim_1600x600.png)
